name: American Legion Service Officer
description: Expert, no-cost assistance to veterans and their families for VA disability benefits applications and education and employment resources
address: 2122 W. Taylor St, Room 106, Chicago, IL 60612
notes: Located at VA Regional Office building at 2122 W. Taylor St

name: VFW Service Officer - Chicago
organization: Veterans of Foreign Wars Department of Illinois
description: Free VA benefits assistance provided by VFW Service Officers accredited by VA
address: 2122 W. Taylor St, Room 105, Chicago, IL 60612
notes: Located at VA Regional Office building. Walk-in hours: Mon-Thu 8:00-11:30am, 12:30-3:00pm; Fri 8:00am-12:00pm

name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) Service Officer - Chicago
description: DAV accredited representatives providing free claims assistance and benefits counseling
address: 2122 W. Taylor St, Room 104, Chicago, IL 60612
notes: Located at VA Regional Office building at 2122 W. Taylor St

name: AMVETS Service Officer - Chicago
description: AMVETS accredited service officers providing free information, counseling and claims service for all VA benefits
address: 2122 W. Taylor St, Room 109, Chicago, IL 60612
notes: No membership required to receive assistance. Accredited by Department of Veterans Affairs

name: Chicago Veterans Regional Office
description: VA regional office providing counseling about eligibility for benefits and assistance with applications
address: 2122 W. Taylor St, Chicago, IL 60612
notes: Serves 62,000+ veterans in Chicago area. Walk-in visits also accepted

name: Veterans Assistance Commission of Cook County
organization: Veterans Assistance Commission of Cook County (VACCC)
description: Nonprofit providing free expert assistance from VSOs for claims, appeals, and emergency financial assistance to veterans
address: 1100 S. Hamilton Ave, Lower Level, Chicago, IL 60612
notes: Provides emergency aid for rent, utilities, transportation, food, burial, and cremation assistance

name: Cook County Department of Veterans Affairs
organization: Cook County Department of Veterans Affairs (CCVA)
description: County government agency empowering veterans through workshops, outreach services, and resource networks
address: 161 N. Clark St, Suite 2400A, Chicago, IL 60601
notes: Email veterans.affairs@cookcountyil.gov to schedule appointment

name: UIC Veterans Legal Clinic
organization: University of Illinois Chicago College of Law
description: Free legal clinic specializing in appeals of denied VA benefits claims and discharge upgrades
address: 300 S. State St, Chicago, IL 60604
notes: Contact through IL-AFLAN hotline or direct clinic contact

name: Illinois Armed Forces Legal Aid Network (IL-AFLAN)
organization: Illinois Armed Forces Legal Aid Network
description: Statewide network providing FREE legal help to current and former military with VA benefits appeals and civil legal problems
address: 180 N Stetson Ave, Suite 820, Chicago, IL 60601
services: Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims representation
notes: Call 855-IL-AFLAN (855-452-3526) to speak with attorney. Partnership with National Veterans Legal Services Program for federal court representation

name: Jesse Brown VA Medical Center - Veteran Benefits
organization: Veterans Health Administration - VA Chicago Health Care System
description: VA medical center providing health care and benefits counseling for Chicago-area veterans
address: 820 S Damen Ave, Chicago, IL 60612
coverage_area: Chicago, Cook County, Illinois, and 6 northwest Indiana counties
notes: Serves 62,000 veterans. Free parking for veterans with appointments. Military Service Pass available for free Chicago public transit

name: American Legion Veteran Service Office - Detroit
description: VA benefits counseling, disability claims assistance, education resources, and veteran services
address: 477 Michigan Avenue, Room 1231, Detroit, MI 48226
notes: Located in Patrick V. McNamara Federal Building with other VSO offices

name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) Service Office - Detroit
description: Free VA benefits counseling, disability claims assistance, and veteran advocacy services
address: 477 Michigan Avenue, Room 1234, Detroit, MI 48226
notes: Located in Patrick V. McNamara Federal Building

name: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) Service Office - Detroit
description: Free VA benefits counseling, disability claims assistance, and veteran services
address: 477 Michigan Avenue, Room 1228, Detroit, MI 48226
notes: Located in Patrick V. McNamara Federal Building

name: AMVETS Service Office - Detroit
description: VA claims filing assistance, benefits counseling, and veteran advocacy services
address: 477 Michigan Avenue, Suite 1103, Detroit, MI 48226
notes: Located in Patrick V. McNamara Federal Building

name: Detroit VA Regional Benefit Office
description: Federal VA benefits administration including disability compensation, pensions, education, life insurance, and home loans
address: 477 Michigan Avenue, 12th Floor, Detroit, MI 48226
notes: Walk-in or appointment available via VERA scheduling system

name: Wayne County Veterans Services Office
description: County financial assistance for veterans including emergency aid, housing, utilities, burial, and other support services
address: 400 Monroe Street, Suite 405, Detroit, MI 48226
notes: Does not handle federal VA benefits; satellite office in Garden City open Tuesday/Thursday

name: Detroit Vet Center
description: Confidential counseling and support services for veterans and service members with mental health and transition support
address: 11214 East Jefferson Avenue, Detroit, MI 48214
notes: 24/7 Veterans Crisis Line available at 988 (press 1)

name: Michigan Veteran Resource Service Center (MVRSC)
description: Statewide resource center connecting veterans to Veteran Service Officers and access to discharge documents and benefits
address: State of Michigan (multiple locations)
hours: Monday-Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM, 24/7 (211 agents after hours)
notes: Primary entry point for Michigan veterans services

name: Franklin County Veterans Service Commission
description: Provides VA claims assistance, emergency financial assistance, medical transportation, VA disability claims, pension benefits, survivor benefits, and employment assistance
address: 280 E. Broad St., 1st Floor, Columbus, OH 43215
services: VA health care and education benefits
notes: County-level veteran services with needs-based financial assistance

name: DAV Service Office - Columbus
description: Accredited Veterans Service Officers providing free disability compensation assistance, pension appeals, and VA benefits support
address: 420 N. James Road, Columbus, OH 43219-1834
notes: Located within VA Outpatient Clinic, accredited service officer available by appointment only

name: American Legion Service Office - Columbus
organization: The American Legion Department of Ohio
description: Accredited service officers providing free VA disability benefits assistance, pension claims, and appeals support
address: 420 N James Rd, Room 1A045, Columbus, OH 43219
notes: Located at Chalmers P. Wylie VA Ambulatory Care Center

name: AMVETS Department Service Officer - Columbus
description: AMVETS Veteran Service Officers providing free assistance with disability claims, appeals, pension benefits, and VA benefits navigation
address: Columbus, OH
notes: AMVETS is a Congressional chartered veteran advocacy organization

name: Columbus VA Vet Center
description: Provides counseling, benefits referral, education support, and mental health services for combat veterans and their families
address: 855 Bethel Road, Columbus, OH 43214
notes: 24/7 general inquiries available at 877-927-8387

name: VFW Department of Ohio
description: VFW Service Officers trained to assist with disability compensation, pension claims, death benefits, and appeals before VA and Board of Veterans Appeals
address: 35 E Chestnut St Ste 506, Columbus, OH 43215
services: VA and Board of Veterans Appeals representation
notes: Service offered free of charge to all veterans

name: Ohio Department of Veterans Services
description: State government department overseeing county veteran services offices and providing veteran support, benefits coordination, and advocacy
address: 77 South High Street, 7th Floor, Columbus, OH 43215
notes: State cabinet-level agency overseeing 88 county veteran service offices

name: Ohio Military/Veterans Legal Assistance Project
description: Free legal assistance call center for central Ohio veterans and military personnel with civil legal problems including VA appeals and military discharge issues
address: Ohio-based (call center)
notes: Part of Stateside Legal network providing free legal services to military and veterans

name: Columbus VA Benefits Office
description: VA federal office providing benefits application, claims processing, and benefits management for disability, education, health care and other VA programs
address: 420 North James Road, Room 1A-052, Columbus, OH 43219
notes: Located at Chalmers P. Wylie Ambulatory Care Center

name: American Legion Veterans Service Officer - Indianapolis
description: Expert, no-cost assistance to veterans and their families with VA disability benefits applications and resources for education, employment, and benefits
address: 575 N Pennsylvania St, Room 325, Indianapolis, IN 46204
notes: Located in Indianapolis Federal Building on 3rd floor. Walk-ins accepted. Call 1-800-827-1000 for appointments.

name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) Service Officer - Indianapolis
description: VA-accredited VSO providing free assistance with disability compensation, pension benefits, and VA appeals for disabled veterans
address: 575 N Pennsylvania St, Room 324, Indianapolis, IN 46204
notes: National DAV hotline: 877-426-2838 (877 I AM A VET). Located in Indianapolis Federal Building.

name: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) Service Officer - Indianapolis
description: VA-accredited VSO providing free assistance with VA benefits, disability claims, and veteran support services
address: 575 N Pennsylvania St, Room 319, Indianapolis, IN 46204
notes: Also VFW Post 7119 at 6525 N Lee Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46236 (317-823-6180)

name: AMVETS Service Officer - Indianapolis
description: VA-accredited VSO providing free VA claims assistance, employment support, and veteran advocacy services
address: 575 N Pennsylvania St, Suite 307, Indianapolis, IN 46204
notes: Located in Indianapolis Federal Building. Also AMVETS Post 99 at 2840 Lafayette Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46222

name: Paralyzed Veterans of America (PVA) Service Officer - Indianapolis
description: VA-accredited VSO specializing in assistance for veterans with spinal cord injury and related disabilities
address: 575 N Pennsylvania St, Room 313, Indianapolis, IN 46204
notes: Specializes in support for spinal cord injury and dysfunction. Kentucky-Indiana Chapter headquarters in Louisville.

name: Indianapolis VA Regional Benefit Office
description: Federal VA office administering compensation, pension, education, insurance, loan guaranty, and vocational rehabilitation benefits
address: 575 N Pennsylvania St, Room 342, Indianapolis, IN 46204
notes: Federal entrance on Pennsylvania Street. Proper picture ID required. Walk-ins accepted. Call for appointments with VERA.

name: Marion County Office of Veteran Services
organization: Marion County Government / City of Indianapolis
description: County veteran services office connecting veterans with local resources and assisting with benefits applications and veteran support programs
address: Indianapolis, IN (Multiple locations - East and West side offices)
hours: Walk-in hours available at different sites and days
notes: County has 4 full-time CVSOs (County Veteran Service Officers). Email: [email protected] or visit Veteran.Indy.gov

name: Indianapolis Veteran Legal Clinic
description: Free monthly legal clinic providing assistance with VA appeals, military records, discharge upgrades, and veteran-related legal issues
address: Richard L. Roudebush VA Medical Center, 1481 W. 10th St., Indianapolis, IN 46202
hours: 2nd Tuesday of each month, 11:00am-4:00pm (sign in by 3:00pm)
notes: Walk-in clinic. Low-income veterans in need receive free legal help. Ask-a-lawyer format with volunteer attorneys.

name: Hennepin County Veterans Services
description: Accredited county veterans service office providing free assistance with VA disability compensation claims, pension benefits, medical/dental/optical benefits, and emergency resources.
address: 300 South 6th Street, Minneapolis, MN 55487
notes: Accepts walk-in visits and appointments. Online intake form available. Assigned representative calls within 3 business days.

name: DAV (Disabled American Veterans) - Minnesota State Office
description: Nationally accredited VSO providing free benefits assistance through trained Service Officers. Helps with VA disability compensation, pension, vocational rehabilitation, education, life insurance, and death benefits.
address: State Veterans Service Building, 20 West 12th Street, 3rd Floor, St. Paul, MN 55155
notes: Toll-free: 888-317-2291. Serves entire Minnesota through chapter network. Transportation services available to VA medical appointments.

name: American Legion Service Officer - Minnesota
description: Accredited American Legion Service Officers provide free, expert assistance with VA disability benefits applications and guidance through the VA claims process.
address: VA Medical Center, Minneapolis, MN
notes: Department Service Officer: Jeremy Wolfsteller (jwolfsteller@mnlegion.org). Office located at VA Medical Center in Minneapolis.

name: AMVETS - Minnesota State Office
description: AMVETS National Service Officers provide free assistance with VA claims for veterans, dependents, and survivors. Helps with disability compensation and other VA benefits.
address: State Veterans Service Building, 20 West 12th Street, Room 302, St. Paul, MN 55155
services: Scholarships for veterans and family members
notes: Serves veterans, dependents, and survivors. Offers annual scholarships.

name: St. Paul VA Regional Benefit Office
description: Federal VA office administering disability compensation, pensions, education, insurance, loan guaranty, and vocational rehabilitation benefits.
address: 1 Federal Drive, Fort Snelling, St. Paul, MN 55111 (Main office temporarily closed, staff at Minneapolis VAMC)
notes: Main office temporarily closed; staff available at Minneapolis VAMC and via virtual VERA appointments. Call center: 612-725-2000 (weekdays 7 AM-7 PM).

name: Minnesota Department of Veterans Affairs - LinkVet
description: State veterans service line providing support for Minnesota veterans and families seeking state and federal benefits. Seven-day-a-week support available.
address: State Veterans Service Building, 20 West 12th Street, Room 206-C, St. Paul, MN 55155-2006
hours: Seven days per week (24/7 support line)
notes: LinkVet is the primary support line. MDVA operates 8 state veterans homes and 4 state veterans cemeteries.

name: MACV Vetlaw Program - VA Medical Center Clinic
description: Free legal assistance program for veterans pursuing VA appeals and benefits claims. Provides representation for eligible veterans (homeless or at-risk, low-income).
address: 1 Veterans Drive, Flag Atrium Balcony Room 2S 114, Minneapolis, MN 55417

docs_required: Evidence of homelessness or at-risk status

services: Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims representation
notes: Email: vetlaw@mac-v.org. Limited to homeless or at-risk veterans meeting low-income criteria. Representation at VA appeals and U.S. Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims.

name: Minneapolis VA Medical Center - Benefits Assistance
description: VA benefits counselors and outreach specialists available to help veterans understand eligibility, gather documents, and apply for benefits. Also houses VA Regional Office staff.
address: 1 Veterans Drive, Minneapolis, MN 55417
notes: Houses VA Regional Office staff during main office closure. VERA (Video Enabled Redesign Architecture) virtual appointments available. Vetlaw legal clinic located on-site.

name: Milwaukee County Veterans Service Office
organization: Milwaukee County Department of Health and Human Services
description: County veterans service office providing assistance with VA disability claims, education, grants, healthcare, burial, and survivors benefits
address: 6401 W Greenfield Ave, West Allis, WI 53214
notes: Walk-ins welcome. Bus accessible (Route 18). Wheelchair accessible.

name: DAV National Service Office - Milwaukee
description: Accredited representatives providing free professional assistance with VA disability claims and government benefits
address: 5400 West National Avenue, Room 162, Milwaukee, WI 53214
services: Free transportation to VA medical appointments
hours: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday 8:00 AM - 11:30 AM, 12:30 PM - 3:30 PM; Closed Wednesday for training
coverage_area: Milwaukee County, Wisconsin (serves ~12,000 veterans annually; mobile office for rural areas)
notes: Accredited representatives. DAV helps approximately 3,500 veterans and families annually in Wisconsin. Fax: 414-902-9440

name: VFW Department Service Office - Milwaukee
description: Accredited service officers providing free assistance with VA benefits claims and research
address: 5400 West National Avenue, Room 166, Milwaukee, WI 53214
notes: No cost to veterans or family members. Email: vfw.vbamiw@va.gov

name: American Legion Department Service Office - Milwaukee
description: Accredited service officers specializing in expert assistance with veterans benefits
address: 5400 West National Avenue, Room 164, Milwaukee, WI 53214
notes: Staff includes Johnny Rosario and Melissa Vargas. Free of charge service.

name: WDVA Claims Assistance Office
description: VA-accredited representatives assisting with VA benefits claims submission and evidence gathering
address: 5400 W. National Avenue, Room 157, Milwaukee, WI 53214
notes: Walk-ins welcome. VA-accredited representative. Email: claims@dva.wi.gov

name: Milwaukee VA Regional Benefit Office
description: Federal VA office administering compensation, pension, and veteran readiness benefits
address: 5400 West National Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53214
notes: Schedule appointments via Visitor Engagement Reporting Application (VERA). Virtual and in-person appointments available.

name: Milwaukee Vet Center
description: Readjustment counseling center for veterans providing mental health and counseling services
address: 7910 North 76th Street, Suite 100, Milwaukee, WI 53223
notes: No need for VA health enrollment or service-connected disability. No discharge character restrictions. Non-medical counseling center. Fax: 414-434-0128
